headline: First two Venezuelan oil cargoes by Chevron after license depart to US
summary: The U.S. Treasury Department granted Chevron a new license in late July allowing it to operate in the sanctioned South American country and export its oil, a policy shift from more strict rules the Trump administration had imposed earlier this year.  Chevron is separately negotiating the reactivation of a supply agreement with Valero Energy that could give the U.S. refiner a portion of Chevron's entitled cargoes of Venezuelan crudes, which are popular among U.S. Gulf refiners, sources have said.

raw.headline: First two Venezuelan oil cargoes by Chevron after license depart to US
raw.summary: The U.S. Treasury Department granted Chevron a new license in late July allowing it to operate in the sanctioned South American country and export its oil, a policy shift from more strict rules the Trump administration had imposed earlier this year.  Chevron is separately negotiating the reactivation of a supply agreement with Valero Energy that could give the U.S. refiner a portion of Chevron's entitled cargoes of Venezuelan crudes, which are popular among U.S. Gulf refiners, sources have said.

headline: Trump–Putin Meeting Keeps Oil Markets in Wait-and-See Mode
summary: Oil markets have seen thin liquidity and rangebound prices this week, with ICE Brent hovering near $66 a barrel as traders focus almost entirely on the upcoming Trump–Putin meeting in Alaska.

headline: Algeria Close to Signing Shale Gas Deals with Exxon and Chevron
summary: Algeria is nearing final agreements with Exxon and Chevron to explore and invest in its shale gas resources, aiming to significantly boost its gas pipeline and LNG exports.
